channel.title: RAM, Pins and Shops?
channel.description:
Howdy ya'll. Couple of questions (keep in mind I'm not too savvy when it comes to PC hardware).
Ignore: [size=8pt][s]Okay so my PC has four "184-pin DDR DIMM sockets" (I'm guessing this is RAM), is it possible to install four "1GB, 240-pin DIMM, DDR2 PC2-5300" even though they have 240 pins? Or would I have to look for memory with 184-pins? (I know you can only put like 3.5gb of RAM on windows 32-bit, but this is just an example)
And also quick question, any good online shops that sell graphics cards and such and deliver to the UK? (I don't know if Newegg do...)[/s][/size]
EDIT: A 400W PSU is fine when it comes to installing a new graphics card.. or not?
NVM I'm a retard. Okay to set things straight: - It's not dual core, just a normal processor (PentiumD 930 (P) DC 3.0 GHz). - The sockets [i]are[/i] DDR2, 240-pin (Which makes my question now obvious, turns out I was looking at a different product spec *facepalm*)
So now I'm just wondering if I would be able to use a [url=http://www1.sapphiretech.com/us/products/products_overview.php?gpid=244]Sapphire Radeon HD 4850[/url] or would I have to think a bit lower power? (Note: I do have 1 available PCI express slot, after taking out my current graphics card)
My spec (Don't laugh people :( ): [url=http://h10025.www1.hp.com/ewfrf/wc/document?docname=c00599879&lc=en&dlc=en&cc=sg&lang=en&product=1838790]Specifications[/url]

item.title: RAM, Pins and Shops?
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

Meh, any problems with it and I’ll sell it and just buy an even sexier one. Too late to cancel now anyway they dispatched :P.

item.title: RAM, Pins and Shops?
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“goatee, post:23, topic:295756”]Really? I just bought it XD.

Oh well I have 1 year warranty. Any proof of these “bang” incidents?[/quote]
no proof im afraid but they are an own brand, and thus made cheaply with cheap things. Just be weary of it thats all and dont push it too hard. They can last the year but its highly possible they can cause accidents, there is a small chance you could have no issues. Increasing that chance wll be to not overload it and the warranty is always a big help so should be fine

Read full topic

@goatee wrote:

Would this suffice? http://www.novatech.co.uk/novatech/prods/Components/PowerSupplies/Novatech/NOV-PSU500.html

Also, what’s the difference between:

This and This?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 18, 2009, 11:21:14 am[/size]

item.title: RAM, Pins and Shops?
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

The GDDR3 memory is dedicated to GPU. It has nothing to do with system memory.

You will need a new power supply:

–450 Watt or greater power supply with 75 Watt 6-pin PCI Express® power connector recommended (550 Watt and two 6-pin connectors for ATI CrossFireX™ technology in dual mode)

Read full topic

item.title: RAM, Pins and Shops?
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

Lets just get this straight people! I was looking at the wrong pc specs when I said it took DDR Ram okay? My PC takes DDR2 so we are all fine and dandy yup?

If a graphics card has for example 512mb of GDDR3 memory, does my motherboard need DDR3 slots, or is that memory just for the GPU to use?

Read full topic

item.title: RAM, Pins and Shops?
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

you want DDR ram?ive got 2GB of it in some old machines upstairs and work have got tonnes of unopened 128mb DDR sticks

Read full topic

item.title: RAM, Pins and Shops?
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

don’t buy ram for DDR1 motherboard, at least get something DDR2, cheap DDR2 mobo = cheap ram = cheap decent CPU

item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

well seeing you have one pci express X16 which probably has the current graphics card just pull that one out and place this 4850 that you want there. And heres the ram you should get…fuck well nvm newegg is running fucking slow wtf…so I cant give you any suggestions on that…

item.title: RAM, Pins and Shops?
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

[quote=“chrisn2323, post:12, topic:295756”][quote author=goatee link=topic=391753.msg2917283#msg2917283 date=1250539677]
NVM I’m a retard. Okay to set things straight:

  • It’s not dual core, just a normal processor (PentiumD 930 § DC 3.0 GHz).
  • The sockets are DDR2, 240-pin (Which makes my question now obvious, turns out I was looking at a different product spec facepalm)

So now I’m just wondering if I would be able to use a Sapphire Radeon HD 4850 or would I have to think a bit lower power? (Note: I do have 1 available PCI express slot, after taking out my current graphics card)

My spec (Don’t laugh people ):
Specifications
[/quote]
what? google says your processor is dual core, and the “DC” in PentiumD 930 § DC 3.0 GHz probably stands for dual core

just make sure that your system wont bottleneck your gpu.

also make sure the power supply is powerful enough[/quote]
I am such a retard, I honestly thought the DC meant direct current… ffs.

Power supply is 400w, and after reading some reviews I think it should be fine. Ordered the RAM, still undecided on the graphics card.

If it doe bottleneck, then I’ll just slowly upgrade all the other parts when I come across money.

Read full topic

item.title: RAM, Pins and Shops?
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

online shops (UK)
overclockers.co.uk
ebuyer.com

Novatech

Novatech | Custom PCs, Laptops, Workstations & Servers

Novatech are a Hampshire based specialist manufacturer of Custom, Gaming, Desktop PCs, Laptops, Workstations and Servers & PC Components available to ship now


dabs.com
A 400W PSU is fine so long as the graphics card wont draw alot, its likely if you are getting a good graphics card then no you will need a new PSU. As for the RAM i dont think you can but someone else can clarify because im not 100% sure

Read full topic
